description.narrative: 1. Common space for dialogue between conflicting communities established 2. A national infrastructure capable of leading South Sudan's peace and reconciliation agenda established

comment.narrative: 1. No space for dialogue 2. No infrastructure for peace

1. 12 actions are undertaken to support the establishment of a common forum for dialogue across conflicting communities 2. A technical strategy/concept note that articulates the design and modality of South Sudans Infrastructure for Peace is drafted in consultation with key stakeholders.

1. 12 new actions were undertaken by the NPPR commemorating the International Day of Peace in six (6) states. Two (2) of those actions were specifically targeting women and five (5) specifically targeting youth. To date, a total of 17 actions have been completed through the NPPR. 2. The Infrastructure for Peace (IfP) workshop was conducted and resulted in a strategic document

description.narrative: 1. Number of institutional policies developed to enhance operations (by institution and type of policy). 2. Number of strategic plans/frameworks developed to implement established policies. 3. Proportion of targeted institutions reporting improved work-related performance by the twins 4. Proportion of twins expressing satisfaction over the twinning arrangements.

comment.narrative: 1. Cabinet Memos prepared for submission of 2 policy documents to the Council of Ministers: Government Records Management Policy and The Civil Service Training Policy. 2. 3 strategic plans approved and 1 framework (South Sudan Pensions Fund By-laws). 3. 80% of the supervisors reported improved skills of twins . 4. 95% of twins gained knowledge from their coach/mentor

description.narrative: 1. Number of persons benefiting from legal aid and legal advice 2. Number of police and social workers trained and deployed to SPUs in five states 3. ECCs in Wau and Juba operational 4. Percentage of Police personnel issued with identity cards

comment.narrative: 1. 0 2. 0 3. No Emergency Call Centers in South Sudan 4. 0

1. 145 people (61 female) received legal aid and legal services through MoJ and CBOs 2. 84 (12 social workers (7 women) and 72 police personnel (41 women) trained and deployed to SPUs in five states. 3. Planning, preparation, and consultation for establishment of ECC in Wau continued. ECC responded to 6,385 calls, including 306 for SGBV and 1,266 for medical emergencies. 4. 46.34% (14.8% female) of police personnel have been verified.

1. 687 (289 female) people received legal aid and legal advice. 2. 10 (3 female) police and 41 (26 female) social workers trained in SGBV and deployed to SPUs in Juba and Wau. 3. Juba ECC operational and establishment of Wau ECC is ongoing. 161 (24 female) police personnel from Wau were trained in ECC services. 4. 23% of police personnel have been issued ID cards.
